sentences.en: For years, from newspapers, broadcasts, the stages and at meetings , we had heard nothing but grandiloquent rhetoric delivered with shouts and shrieks that deafened the ears.
sentences.cn: 多少年来, 报纸上, 广播里, 舞台上,会场上的声嘶力竭, 装腔做态的高调搞得我们震耳欲聋.

sentences.en: He prefered, in his grandiloquent way , to call a spade a spade.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢夸夸其谈地谈出事实的真相来.

sentences.en: Indeed, no eulogy could be more grandiloquent than this.
She attacked her colleagues for indulging in "grandiose and grandiloquent language".
sentences.cn: 她抨击同事“言辞浮夸做作”。

sentences.en: There are about 900 English translations of the Bible, ranging from the grandiloquent to the colloquial.
sentences.cn: 《圣经》大约有900种英语译本, 范围从浮华做作到通俗白话.

words.tran_cn: 豪言壮语，豪语；夸张之言
夸张的；夸大的；大言不惭的

trans.tran_en: Grandiloquent language or behaviour is very formal, literary, or exaggerated, and is used by people when they want to seem important
